The Pregnancy Discrimination Act passed 41 years ago, but it fails to protect pregnant workers and does not require reasonable workplace accommodations. As a mom & policy maker, I am proud to support the Pregnant Workers Fairness Act to #ProtectPregnantWorkers. pic.twitter.com/r4m4HyDRF2

The impeachment provisions are in our Constitution for challenging times such as this, and I take my obligation to uphold the Constitution seriously. I will continue to work with my colleagues to uncover the truth and to do what is best for the American people.

The next phase of the impeachment inquiry will allow Oregonians and people across the country to witness the process designed by our Founding Fathers to uphold our values and maintain the checks and balances that are important to a functioning democracy.

The President must be held accountable for his actions. Evidence already uncovered, along with the President’s own remarks, show a betrayal of the Constitution and a threat to national security. #TruthExposed

I am proud of the work we have done crafting the College Affordability Act, and I’ll continue to fight for improvements to the higher education system that help students and our communities. https://bonamici.house.gov/media/press-releases/bonamici-sponsored-bill-make-higher-education-more-affordable-advances-house …

📘 Improve the student loan repayment system
📕 Update the Federal Work Study Program
📘 Support students with disabilities
📕 Strengthen financial counseling
📘 Help address student hunger
The #CollegeAffordabilityAct makes long overdue updates to the Higher Education Act. The bill includes many policies from legislation I’ve previously introduced, including provisions to:

Our communities & our economy are stronger when every student can get the best education possible to prepare them for success in whatever path they take in life. Today @EdLaborCmte approved legislation I helped lead to make that possible. The bill will now move to the House floor pic.twitter.com/2eenNepe91

I look forward to continuing to work with my Congressional Nursing Caucus co-chairs on efforts that benefit nurses and our communities.

Nurses serve our communities day & night, coming to our aid in times of need & protecting public health. I applaud the passage of this bill today and look forward to working with my colleagues in the Senate to get this bill signed swiftly into law and better empower every older American to age with dignity. https://bonamici.house.gov/media/press-releases/house-passes-bonamici-bill-update-older-americans-act …

The Dignity in Aging Act provides meaningful increases in funding for all OAA programs, which will help expand access to food assistance & other basic services that help seniors live independently and with dignity. It also supports caregivers, combats social isolation, & more.

When I chaired a hearing about updating the OAA, Lee Girard of @MultCo testified about the need for increased funding to meet the growing demand. https://bonamici.house.gov/media/press-releases/bonamici-chairs-hearing-update-older-americans-act …
I have heard too many stories about seniors rationing medication or saving portions of their meals so that they can stretch their resources a bit further.

The Older Americans Act serves about 11 million individuals each year through social services and community-based programs. More people are living longer, but funding has not kept up with increasing need for services.
Today the House passed my bipartisan update, the Dignity in Aging Act of 2019, to provide seniors and their caregivers with desperately needed resources and expanded services.

More than 50 years ago, Congress passed the Older Americans Act so seniors can live with dignity. The OAA includes important programs like Meals on Wheels, community meal programs, caregiver support, and elder abuse prevention. pic.twitter.com/vYCHTdVrLT

He garnered respect by treating everyone with kindness, and he never forgot his humble roots. The beautiful celebration of his life today was a testament to his character. May he rest in peace. pic.twitter.com/8r8IfsMabT

Congressman Elijah Cummings was a man of integrity and compassion. The son of sharecroppers, he worked hard throughout his life - as a lawyer, state legislator, and a leader in Congress. pic.twitter.com/s1q4YhvBoC

With the Pregnant Workers Fairness Act, Congress can take an important step toward workplace gender equity, healthy pregnancies, and the economic security of all pregnant and parenting women and their families. We must #ProtectPregnantWorkers https://youtu.be/037DPnH0_xA

Today I chaired an @EdLaborCmte Civil Rights & Human Services hearing on the Pregnant Workers Fairness Act. This bipartisan bill will establish the right of pregnant workers to reasonable accommodations & guarantee that pregnant workers can seek accommodations without retaliation

As a mom & a policy maker, I know how important it is to protect the economic security of pregnant women & working families. Unfortunately our current laws are inadequate, and pregnant women continue to suffer workplace discrimination at an alarming rate. pic.twitter.com/7c7gTn8KoX

The legislation will also reinvest some of the hundreds of billions in dollars in savings back into developing new therapies and improving health care for all Americans. I encourage my colleagues to quickly pass this bill. https://bonamici.house.gov/media/press-releases/bonamici-sponsored-bill-lower-prescription-drug-prices-advances-house-floor …
H.R. 3 will help lower out-of-pocket expenses, particularly for seniors because it will have Medicare negotiate for lower prices.

I've also dealt with out-of-pocket costs of about $300 a month for just one of my mother’s medications. She’s a 91-year-old cancer survivor with Alzheimer's. We were able to cover that cost, but what about families who can’t afford the cost of lifesaving medication?

The list price for that drug was more than $250, and he was responsible for a 20% copay. Jon is fortunate because he has insurance, and he was not forced to choose between life-saving medication and putting food on the table. Too many Americans are not so lucky.

I recently held six town hall meetings in five counties across Northwest Oregon—and the issue of unaffordable drug prices came up at every single one of them. In Cornelius, a gentleman named Jon held up a small tube of medication and shared his experience.
Action to address skyrocketing prescription drug costs is long overdue. I’m glad to join my @EdLaborCmte colleagues today in advancing H.R. 3, the #LowerDrugCosts Now Act. pic.twitter.com/GdqjBQfr0K

It’s extremely difficult for students to focus on their education when they are hungry or worrying about where to find their next meal.
